entry.title: [omnibox] Passes OmniboxController to OmniboxEditModel constructor
entry.content:
Simplifies code by passing OmniboxController to OmniboxEditModel

constructor. Also stops passing OmniboxClient to OmniboxEditModel

constructor and holding a reference to it. The edit model instead

gets a reference to OmniboxClient via OmniboxController which owns

that instance. This is more consistent with how the edit model accesses

the AutocompleteController and AutocompleteResult and simplifies test

setups.

entry.title: Avoid dereferencing `RenderThread::Get()` in more of extension tracing.
entry.content:
The tracing statements changed in this CL are always executing on the

main thread, so `RenderThread::Get()` should never be null and therefore

these statements should not be causing crashes like the ones reported in

https://crbug.com/1444377. OTOH, avoiding the dereference makes the

code simpler and more obviously correct.

entry.title: CodeHealth: FakeWebAppProvider::Set* disconnects instead of doing it in Get()
entry.content:
Setting a subsystem on FakeWebAppProvider after it's started, or using a

subsystem before it's connected is a potential error, because the

subsystems won't be connected together properly. To prevent this,

FakeWebAppProvider::Get() was setting `connected_ = false` to force

`Start()` to be called to connect the subsystems. This has the

unfortunate side effect of making `Get` mutate the state so it can't be

used as a regular getter.



This CL makes `Get` non-mutating and instead makes each `Set*` method

ensure connected_ = false.



Possible unit tests this would simplify (no longer need to hold a

FakeWebAppProvider field:

https://source.chromium.org/search?q=raw_ptr.*FakeWebAppProvider%5C%3E&sq=package:chromium



Change-Id: I3e67d612abc89ff0702dd0ddaa2c697d279f39a8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4531744

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

Commit-Queue: Glen Robertson

Auto-Submit: Glen Robertson

Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

entry.title: Keep track of last provisioning attempt on Android R
entry.content:
On Android R a bug in the OS can cause MediaDrm::getProvisionRequest()

to crash. As this may happen shortly after startup when

pre-provisioning, Chrome will be unusable if that happens.

So use |kLastProvisioningTimeToken| to keep track of the last attempt

to pre-provision, and don't try again within |kExpirationDelta|.

Value is cleared if provisioning returns, so on devices without

the crash things will work as normal.



Tested on Android R emulator with a simulated crash inside

MediaDrmBridge.java.



Bug: 1430660

Test: see above

Change-Id: I5861ec69cdcd9cf3304b406828b73a55d5d55c55

entry.title: [Read Anything]: make mock blocks more explicit
entry.content:
"When it’s being destroyed, your friendly mock object will automatically

verify that all expectations on it have been satisfied"[1].



This means each instance of EXPECT_CALL simply queue up an expectation

but it isn't checked until the end of the test. The RA tests seem to use

mocks as if expectations get checked in-between EXPECT_CALL(s) which

isn't true.



1. http://google.github.io/googletest/gmock_cook_book.html



R=abigailbklein@google.com

entry.title: Remove test coverage of QR metrics logged in the utility process.
entry.content:
I've forgotten that testing of UMA metrics logged in the utility process

is inherently flaky - see https://crbug.com/1246137. To avoid the

flakiness this CL removes test coverage for such UMA metrics. Less test

coverage should still be okay, because the code logging the metrics is

fairly simple and the UMA dashboard (e.g. see go/rusty-qr-metrics) shows

that the metrics are logged.

Before this CL, the process may not have received "ready" signal from

xvfb/openbox but would still proceed after ~1s. This change bumps it to

~3s and only proceeds if signal is received.



Also catch exceptions when trying to kill processes. Sometimes calls

like .terminate() can raise (zombie processes?) and interrupt other

kill() calls from e.g. finally blocks.

entry.title: [omnibox] Single way to construct OmniboxController
entry.content:
`OmniboxController` provides two constructor, one for the realbox which

does not use `OmniboxView` and passes an instance of

`AutocompleteController`, and another for the omnibox which does use

`OmniboxView` and whose `AutocompleteController` is created inside the

`OmniboxController`.



This change introduces a single constructor for `OmniboxController`.

making realbox explicitly pass a nullptr for `OmniboxView` and use

the `AutocompleteController` instance created by `OmniboxController`.

entry.title: [Mac Window Minimize] Adjust to macOS 13 window minimize semantics
entry.content:
On macOS13, calling miniaturize: on a window is no longer "atomic"

in that it involves a non-blocking round-trip RPC with the Dock. This

causes problems for code watching for window state changes, when those

checks occur while the application is in an inconsistent state (i.e.

miniaturized: was called but isMiniaturized returns NO).



This cl prevents the round-trip miniaturization from miniaturizing

the window if some operation has effectively canceled it (such as

an orderFront:).



Test: out/Default/interactive_ui_tests \

--gtest_filter=SessionRestoreInteractiveTest.RestoreMinimizedWindow*

entry.title: [Downloads] Record web app that initiated a download in history DB
entry.content:
This changes the existing by_ext_id column in the downloads table, which records the ID of the extension that downloaded the file, renaming it

to by_ext_or_web_app_id, so that it may now record the ID of the

web app that initiated the download. These are mutually exclusive, so

the field can be shared between them. A new boolean column is added to

record whether the column is for a web app or an extension.



Increments DB version to 64.



Also updates the README to document the current process for generating

test sql schema files.



Bug: 1420454

entry.title: Eagerly update the accessibility tree during the lifecycle step.
entry.content:
What this this CL does:

* Introduce a new dirty bit called needs_update_ that is meant to

indicate whether step (2) below should happen for that AX object,

or one of its descendants.

* Implement a first piece of step (2): walk the AX tree from the root, updating children and attributes for

all AX objects that have the dirty bit. Early out if the bit is not set.



This CL is written (on purpose) to be a change that should have no

effect on correctness (no effect, because the tree will still lazily

update even if this update doesn't happen, or is incomplete). However,

it may reduce the impact of existing bugs that only reproduce during

lazy updates outside of rendering (such as during serialization or some other code path that reads AX data).





This is one small step towards changing the lifecycle update code to

be like this:



1. Invalidate parts of the AX tree (via methods like ProcessInvalidatedObjects, ProcessCleanLayoutCallbacks, and ProcessUpdatesWithCleanLayout).



2. Update the invalidated parts of the tree.



This end state will avoid problems where tree updates happen

unexpectedly, leading to crashes and other errors.



Subsequent CLs will gradually reduce the amount of eager rebuilding

that happens during (1) and do it in (2) instead, and also gradually

replace code in (1) with dirty-bit setting.



Follow-up tasks:



1. Add CHECKS for cached value accessors once https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4466969 lands.



2. Ensure that the second AX tree update only fixes maps and aria relations.



Perf test results from blink_perf.accessibility:



ProcessDeferredAccessibilityEvents got slower, and RenderAccessibilityImpl::SendPendingAccessibilityEvents got faster. The net difference was very small, about 16ms net across a number of tests. None of the blink_perf.accessibility tests got substantially

slower (and a few got a little bit faster).



Bug: 1342801



Change-Id: Idf19a65658ed4878a24dec0e28c0a6e334609208

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4436950

Commit-Queue: Chris Harrelson

entry.title: bento_button: Add hover support to desk button desk bar
entry.content:
This adds hover support to desk button desk bar by migrating hover

related stuff to desk bar base.



Within desk bar view, it relies on the saved desk presenter to see

whether to show or hide the library button. Since the presenter is not

available outside of overview, this moves the job to check to the bar.

When there is an update, the presenter will notify the bar to check

again. This design works for both bar types and will save a lot of

repeated work.



In addition, this migrates desks test api to use base class and adds

support for the new bar.



All/DeskButtonTest.DeskBarBasic/*

All/DeskButtonTest.DeskBarScrollLayout/*

All/DeskButtonTest.DeskBarHoverBasic/*



Bug: b:278946144

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Fold GenericV4L2Device into V4L2Device
entry.content:
This CL folds GenericV4L2Device into V4L2Device since the former is

the only derived class of V4L2Device, which is itself far from

abstract.



For that the CL removes the pure abstract methods, copying the

bodies into an approximate good location in the .cc file -- only

approximate because the method definitions don't follow their

declaration order and I didn't want to muddy git history too much.



The history of the moved code will likely be lost though; looking

at the implementation it looks simple enough to me that there

shouldn't be questions about it that need going back in history to

answer.



No new functionality intended, only moving code around. In particular

the method bodies are copied verbatim.



Bug: b:279980150

entry.title: media: Media Foundation Clear Key CDM enabling HW GPU bots
entry.content:
New test suite `media_foundation_browser_tests` with

WIN10_INTEL_UHD_630_STABLE added to builder

`win_optional_gpu_tests_rel` to enable HW GPU bots to run

MediaFoundation browser tests on the required Windows OS with a HW GPU.



- Added `gpu_default_and_optional_win_media_foundation_specific_gtests`

test suite to run MediaFoundation browser tests on a minimally required

Windows OS with a MediaFoundation supported hardware GPU. Also passing

`--use-gpu-in-tests` flag to render image correctly.

- Added this new test suit into the existing

`win_optional_gpu_tests_rel` builder with WIN10_INTEL_UHD_630_STABLE

variant which supports HW secure decryption.

- Note that WIN10_NVIDIA_GTX_1660_STABLE is running on WIN10_19H2

(Version 1909, Build 18363) which doesn't support HW secure

decryption.

- Added new location filters to detect any CDM and Media Foundation

related changes that should trigger `win_optional_gpu_tests_rel` bot:

media/cdm/.+

chrome/browser/media/.+

components/cdm/renderer/.+

media/base/win/.+ ---> already included

media/renderers/win/.+ ---> already included

media/filters/win/.+ ---> already included

- For `win-rel` bot, this flag is not passed so it will skip the

test. Otherwise, it will end up with the failure to create D3D11

device with a software OpenGL implementation. This way

`media_foundation_browser_tests` can trigger MediaFoundation browser

tests on the correct Windows machine with a hardware GPU. On local

machines, you still need to pass `--use-gpu-in-tests` flag manually.



Some auto-generated files:

- tryserver.chromium.win.json is auto-generated by

`.\testing\buildbot\generate_buildbot_json.py`.

- cq-builders.md, full.cfg and commit-queue.cfg are auto-generated by

running `lucicfg generate .\infra\config\main.star`.



Build command:

```

autoninja -C out\Default browser_tests



.\out\Default\browser_tests --gtest_filter=MediaFoundationEncryptedMediaTest.Playback_ClearLeadEncryptedCencVideo_Success --use-gpu-in-tests

.\out\Default\browser_tests --gtest_filter=MediaFoundationEncryptedMediaTest.Playback_ClearLeadEncryptedCbcsVideo_Success --use-gpu-in-tests

.\out\Default\browser_tests --gtest_filter=MediaFoundationEncryptedMediaTest.Playback_EncryptedVp9CencAudio_MediaTypeUnsupported --use-gpu-in-tests

```



Bug: 1235887, 1444893

Change-Id: Ic75e32760261fa1d359760334afab57569cd297d

entry.title: Ensure that SupplementalDevicePickerProducer returns a non-empty item
entry.content:
SDPP's item may not have been created yet when MediaNotificationService::SetDialogDelegateForWebContents() is called, since SDPP::CreateItem() can be called asynchronously via Mojo. In those cases we create the item in SetDialogDelegateForWebContents() (and the later CreateItem() call would be a no-op).

entry.title: media: Add UMA for CDM session key status mix
entry.content:
The current Media.EME.Widevine.SoftwareSecure.KeyStatusSystemCode

UMA is not very useful because it's reported for every session for

every key status update and for each key. So real signals could be

easily lost.



This CL introduces a new UMA which is reported for every session, only

for the first key status update, and only report a summary (the mix)

of key statuses.



Tested by playing a protected content video, and observed all keys

are usable. Then observed the following in about://histograms:



```

- Histogram: Media.EME.Widevine.SoftwareSecure.InitialKeyStatusMix recorded 1 samples, mean = 0.0 (flags = 0x41) [#]

0 -O (1 = 100.0%)

1 ...

```



Bug: b/280703997

Test: See above

Change-Id: I3bbf608f78895ef7fc1820a9f129c262886a8aee

entry.title: Use ProcessLock URL to identify if a page is an NTP
entry.content:
This is part of the work for SiteInstanceGroup to move

RenderFrameProxyHost from SiteInstance to SiteInstanceGroup, which

requires RenderFrameProxyHost to no longer have a SiteInstance. One

current use case for SiteInstance is to pass in to

ContentBrowserClient::OverrideNavigationParams, where it is then used

to identify if the page is an NTP.

This change changes ContentBrowserClient::OverrideNavigationParams to

take the ProcessLock's URL instead of getting the URL from the source

SiteInstance.



Test: No behaviour change

entry.title: [ChromeCart][Quest] Fix wrong matching for store.google.com cart
entry.content:
Currently we associate cart with Quest based on the eTLD+1 of visits

in this Quest. Since a large portion of Quests contain google.com

visits, this will mistakenly associate a cart from store.google.com

with many unrelated Quests. This CL fixes this issue by only matching

Google cart when we know that the visit is from store.google.com.

entry.title: Refactor creation of histogram shared memory allocator to a helper.
entry.content:
This CL extracts the configuration and creation of histogram shared

memory regions/allocators to helpers with unit-test coverage.



There is no change in functionality.



This change is a first step towards creating the histogram shared memory segments before launching child processes and passing the shared memory handles to the children as launch parameters. Earlier creation + pass on launch will allow for the histogram shared memory to be available to the child for any histograms recorded early in the child's lifetime. Currently, these histograms can be lost if the child process ends before the shared memory channel is established (during the first browser-child IPC).





Bug: 1028263, 1290457, 1246137

Change-Id: Ie7e1821512eac82c90596edf0e2b5fe42b7fbc13

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4508165

entry.title: [scroll-animations] Make resolved source part of the timeline state
entry.content:
For deferred timelines v2, it we have to be able to produce a state

snapshot without any side effects. We are currently updating

the resolved source as a side-effect of ComputeTimelineState,

and this CL addresses that.



This also fixes a few cases of checking "IsResolved" using

the previously resolved source, instead of the freshly resolved source.

We now instead pass the correct resolved source as a parameter

to relevant functions.



Finally, timelines are now kept alive via the reference element rather

than than the resolved source.



Bug: 1425939

Change-Id: I923660974a129440ce72f65ee821584329c6bbd9

Fixed: 1430085

entry.title: [SafetyCheck] Propagate (re)setting of permission to the modules
entry.content:
Fixes an issue where (re-)setting permissions through page info or in site settings would not propagate to the review UIs.

With this change (re-)setting permissions will stop the site from being hidden in the notification permission module when a user has clicked 'always allow'. Additionally, the site will be removed from the list of revoked unused site permissions.





Bug: 1345920

entry.title: Build Chromium with panic=abort
entry.content:
When building an official build, also build the stdlib with --cfg

panic_immediate_abort to reduce binary size and eliminate symbols

being added for everything that may panic.



Proc macros and other build-time-only artifacts are built with a

separate Rust toolchain that uses the prebuilt stdlib that we ship

with the compiler. This means proc macros can unwind instead of

crashing the compiler (which is nice). It also unblocks proc macros

and build scripts from starting to be compiled (and run, in the latter

case) while the stdlib used for Chromium itself is still being

compiled.



Previously we had a separate toolchain called _no_sanitizers which

was used for building proc macros. Now we extend that to use the

prebuilt stdlib (avoiding building the stdlib twice and allowing

panic=unwind) and rename it to _for_rust_host_build_tools.



This toolchain is always put in `is_debug=false` and

`is_component_build=false` which sidesteps problems with the Rust

stdlib not being able to link the Windows Debug CRT, and the

Windows CRT DLLs not being present in this toolchains's out dir, but

is also the right choice for building things that will be used as

part of the build system (even part of the compiler) in order to

make Chromium builds faster.



Bug: 1439241, 1434719

Change-Id: I5814876ada18f8a8262765916070ad506b2f8b79

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:win-rust-x64-rel,win-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,android-rust-arm64-rel,linux-rust-x64-dbg,android-rust-arm64-dbg,android-rust-arm32-rel
